Those that, by faith, they believed God and how they were moved and what they did and so on and so forth, and we find that Joseph, the statement that we read in Genesis 50, is recorded for us in Hebrews chapter 11. It tells us this in Hebrews 11 and verse 22. By faith Joseph, when he died, made mention of the departing of the children of Israel and gave commandment concerning his bones. By faith he believed God. The Bible tells us the just shall live by faith. Amen? The Bible tells us in this chapter, in Hebrews chapter 11 and verse number 6, without faith it is impossible to please Him. For he that cometh to God must believe that He is, and that He is a rewarder of them that diligently seek Him. God desires that His people would live a life of faith, that we believe God. I believe the most simple definition of faith is believing God, taking God at His Word. It doesn't mean that you can understand how everything's going to work out, it just means that you believe God. I think of Paul when he's in the storm, the end of the book of Acts, and he stands and he simply says, I believe God, that it shall be as it was revealed unto me. There was an angel that stood by him and told him of the deliverance that would come to pass. And in that particular storm they were hoping and wishing for the day, they thought for sure they were all dead men, but he said, I believe God. Not one will be lost. And you know what? They made it ashore. None of them lost their lives. This evening we think about the life of Joseph, we end this wonderful book, the book of Genesis, a life that's marked by obedience, a life that's marked by troubles, a life that's marked by blessing, and a life that's marked by faith. I wonder tonight if each of us were to examine our own lives, better yet if someone to read your story, what would they walk away with? See, most of us are probably pretty glad that God didn't record our story for countless generations of people to study, amen? But if He did, how would someone conclude your life? What would the summary statements be that are made of your life? I hope that it could be said, even as it's said of Joseph, as we make these conclusion type statements, it's a life marked by obedience, troubles, yes, blessings, abundant, a life of faith. He believed God. Oh, that God would help us to have faith. Oh, that God would help us to obey Him, to just follow Him. You say, but the troubles, yes, the troubles will come. Keep your eyes on Jesus, the author and finisher of our faith. He's got a plan. He does, He doeth all things well. We serve a great God. Joseph, 54 years summarized in just a few verses of Scripture, an exemplary Bible character, one in which we look at his life and we say, oh, that God would allow me to be used in like fashion. Let's pray together. Father, we love You. Thank You for loving us. Thank You for Your Word, the truth that's contained therein. We thank You for the life of Joseph. I pray, Lord, that You'd help us to be men and women of faith, men and women of obedience. Help us to be used of Thee. I pray, Lord, that in this moment of invitation that You'd have Your will and way. Lord, maybe there's someone that's been living in disobedience, Lord, someone that's tried to justify some of their disobedience. Oh, I pray, Holy Spirit, that You'd convict them and help them, Lord, to respond not by justification but respond with confession. Lord, help us to have faith. Help us to live by faith. I pray that You'd increase our faith. Help us to believe You. I pray that You'd move and work as only You can for it's in Christ's name we pray. Would You stand with me? Heads are bowed, eyes are closed. Holly's going to play quietly on the piano, and as she does, the altar is open.
